articles.title: NK cell-mediated tumor cell killing by bispecific innate cell engagers induces ADCC-mediated activation of primary human dendritic cells.
articles.summary: Bispecific antibodies targeting NK cells effectively kill tumor cells, activating dendritic cells and potentially enhancing the immune system's ability to fight cancer.

articles.title: Gut microbiome remodeling induced by microplastic exposure in humans.
articles.summary: Microplastic exposure in humans alters gut microbiome composition, potentially increasing disease risks by reducing beneficial bacteria and short-chain fatty acid production.

articles.title: The colloidal stability of albumin-based drug delivery systems has a profound effect on tumoricidal activity.
articles.summary: HSA-PLA nanoparticles with enhanced surface charge and stability improved paclitaxel drug delivery, resulting in greater tumor exposure and antitumor efficacy.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary: In urothelial carcinoma, specific gut microbes can enhance immunotherapy effectiveness by boosting the immune system's ability to fight cancer.

articles.title: Effects of estradiol, tamoxifen, and raloxifene on human temporal lobe cortex astroglial cell spreading.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Estrogen-related compounds differently affect how brain support cells (astrocytes) spread, potentially influencing neural communication and brain health.
